  • Constructor Details

    • King

      public King​(int row, int column, int team)
      Constructor for King.
      Parameters:
      row - Starting row/rank.
      column - Starting column/file.
      team - The piece's team. Should be either ChessPiece.BLACK or ChessPiece.WHITE.

  • Method Details

    • move

      public boolean move​(int newColumn, int newRow)
      Moves the King. Includes special logic that allows for castling.
      Overrides:
      move in class ChessPiece
      Parameters:
      newColumn - The piece's column after the move.
      newRow - The piece's row after the move.
      Returns:
      Returns a boolean value based on if the user has made a valid move.

    • getAllMoves

      public java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getAllMoves()
      Description copied from class: ChessPiece
      Returns all the possible moves available to a piece, without considering if they will put their own King in check.
      Specified by:
      getAllMoves in class ChessPiece
      Returns:
      Returns an ArrayList of coordinate pairs, each representing a possible move whether it is valid or not.

    • safeFrom

      public boolean safeFrom​(java.util.function.IntFunction<java.lang.Integer> rowDirection, java.util.function.IntFunction<java.lang.Integer> colDirection, ChessPiece[][] b)
      Iterates through spaces in a straight line away from the King to check if any pieces in that line can attack the King. Should be used with all 8 possible combinations of rowDirection and colDirection to determine if a King is in check.
      Parameters:
      rowDirection - IntFunction to represent row traversal. r -> r-- for moving left, r -> r++ for moving right.
      colDirection - IntFunction to represent column traversal. c -> c-- for moving down, c -> c++ for moving up.
      b - 8x8 ChessPiece matrix representing the current game state.
      Returns:
      If the King is put into check from a piece in this direction.

    • safeFromKnight

      public boolean safeFromKnight​(ChessPiece[][] b)
      Determines if the King is vulnerable to attack from a Knight. This alternative to safeFrom(java.util.function.IntFunction<java.lang.Integer>,java.util.function.IntFunction<java.lang.Integer>,piece.ChessPiece[][]) is necessary because Knights are the only piece that can attack a King from outside one of the 8 "primary" directions on the chessboard.
      Parameters:
      b - 8x8 ChessPiece matrix representing the current game state.
      Returns:
      If the King is put into check from a Knight in any direction.

    • isCheck

      public boolean isCheck​(ChessPiece[][] b)
      Determines if this King is in check.
      Parameters:
      b - 8x8 ChessPiece matrix representing the current game state.
      Returns:
      True if the player's King is in check, false otherwise.

    • isCheckmate

      public boolean isCheckmate​(ChessPiece[][] b)
      Determines if the King is in checkmate.
      Parameters:
      b - 8x8 ChessPiece matrix representing the current game state.
      Returns:
      True if the player has lost the game, false otherwise.
